intro: Zeugites hackelii, commonly known as the desert hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to arid and semi-arid regions of the Americas. It is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from yellow to orange, often blooming in late spring to early summer. The plant has thick, succulent leaves that help it conserve water in dry environments. Its stems are typically woody and can grow up to several meters in height. Zeugites hackelii is adapted to survive in harsh conditions, making it a resilient species in desert ecosystems.
